content.question: For parts of the free-response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate. Answer the following questions about solutions of <math alttext="N a C l"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C a C l 2"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CaCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Ions in a certain volume of <math alttext="0.20 molar N a C l, aqueous"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NaCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> are represented in the box above on the left. In the box above on the right, draw a particulate diagram that represents the ions in the same volume of <math alttext="0.10 molar C a C l 2, aqueous"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>CaCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

frqParts.text: For parts of the free-response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate. Answer the following questions about solutions of <math alttext="N a C l"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C a C l 2"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CaCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Ions in a certain volume of <math alttext="0.20 molar N a C l, aqueous"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NaCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> are represented in the box above on the left. In the box above on the right, draw a particulate diagram that represents the ions in the same volume of <math alttext="0.10 molar C a C l 2, aqueous"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>CaCl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(b) Briefly explain how the presence of charged ions in ionic solids such as <math alttext="N a C l, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> helps to explain why <math alttext="N a C l, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is soluble in water.

(c) What volume of <math alttext="0.20 molar N a C l, aqueous"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NaCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> contains <math alttext="10.0 grams"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="N a C l"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> (molar mass <math alttext="58 grams per mole"><mstyle><mrow><mn>58</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>)?

skill.text: 3.C: Represent visually the relationship between the structures and interactions across multiple levels or scales (e.g., particulate to macroscopic).
